Description.Html: Production managers make sure manufacturing processes run smoothly and cost-effectively, and deliver products on time.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Knowledge of quality management methods, like Lean and Six Sigma, might be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in production management from The Chartered Institute for Logistics and Transport.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into overall factory management or strategic planning roles at regional or national level.

If you work for a large national or international company, you may have the opportunity to work overseas.

Description.Html: Production workers manufacture goods and parts in industries like pharmaceuticals, food and drink, construction and engineering.

HtbCareerTips.Html: A forklift truck training certificate could be useful for some jobs.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could be promoted to shift supervisor or move into quality control.

Description.Html: Proofreaders check text before it's printed or published to make sure it's correct and complete.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Experience working in publishing or journalism could help you to find jobs.

There's a lot of competition for work and many publishing companies do not advertise vacancies. Jobs are filled through word of mouth or recommendation.

You could develop a portfolio of paid or unpaid work you've done to show your skills to employers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about proofreading careers from the Society for Editors and Proofreaders.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: As an experienced proofreader, you could build up your reputation as a specialist in a particular field or approach publishing companies for work.

Description.Html: Prop makers create objects for use in films, TV programmes and the theatre.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Your creative talent and model-making skills will often be more important than formal qualifications.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about working in props from ScreenSkills.

You can also get more information on working in the creative industries from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move into set design, production design or stage management.

Description.Html: Prosthetists and orthotists care for people who need an artificial limb or a device to support or control part of their body.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about a career as a prosthetist and orthotist from Health Careers and the British Association of Prosthetists and Orthotists.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to a management post or move into a specialist clinical area. You could also move into teaching, or a research and development post.

Description.Html: Psychiatrists are doctors who diagnose and treat patients with mental health problems.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a psychiatrist from the Royal College of Psychiatrists and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you may go on to lead a team, or manage a unit or department. You may also progress to teaching and training students, trainee doctors and other healthcare professionals.

With experience and entry on the General Medical Council (GMC) Specialist Register, you could apply for senior (or consultant) roles.

Description.Html: Psychologists study people's behaviour, motivations, thoughts and feelings, and help them to overcome or control their problems.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice on careers and training in psychology from The British Psychological Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
As your career develops, you could specialise within your branch of psychology, for example:

  • forensic or criminal psychology
  • clinical psychology
  • sports and exercise psychology

You could also take on a research project, leading to a PhD qualification, and combine this with university teaching.

Description.Html: Psychotherapists use talking techniques and therapies to help people who are distressed, or have mental health problems.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in psychotherapy from the British Association for Counselling and Psychotherapy.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could take on a training, teaching or mentoring role.

You could become self-employed and set up a private practice. You could also move into research as a career.

Description.Html: Public finance accountants make sure money is spent properly in public sector organisations.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in public finance accountancy from The Chartered Institute of Public Finance & Accountancy.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could move into management and progress to director of finance.

You could also move into private practice or management accountancy.

Description.Html: Public relations (PR) directors manage communications campaigns and strategy for their organisation or clients.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about a career in public relations from the Public Relations & Communications Association and the Chartered Institute of Public Relations.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move on to a bigger public relations (PR) agency or become the chief executive or head of an organisation.

You could also work as a PR consultant, advising corporate clients on communications strategy and policy.

Description.Html: Public relations (PR) officers manage an organisation's public image and reputation.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Chartered Institute of Public Relations and the Public Relations and Communications Association for training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about the world of public relations from the Chartered Institute of Public Relations and careers in the industry from the Public Relations and Communications Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With in-house PR officer experience, you could be promoted to PR manager, social media manager or head of communications.

With agency experience, you could progress to senior account executive or account manager.

You could go freelance or move into advertising, marketing or journalism.

Description.Html: Publicans manage licensed premises like pubs and bars.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join organisations like the British Institute of Innkeeping and British Beer & Pub Association, for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a publican from British Beer & Pub Association and the Wine and Spirit Education Trust.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
If you're employed by a chain or brewery, you could progress to becoming a regional manager.

You could become self-employed and expand your business by buying additional pubs or bars.

Description.Html: Purchasing managers buy equipment, goods and services for their company.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Chartered Institute of Purchasing and Supply for professional development training and industry contacts, which could help with your career.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more advice about becoming a purchasing manager from the Chartered Institute of Purchasing and Supply.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You can improve your career prospects with a qualification from the Chartered Institute of Purchasing and Supply.

Description.Html: Qualifications and Credit Framework (QCF) assessors support and assess vocational qualifications, helping trainees meet standards.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a training assessor from FE Advice.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With relevant experience and qualifications you could progress to lead an assessor team, move into further education teaching or become a training manager.

You could also work as an internal or external verifier, checking the work of assessors and training centres.

Description.Html: Quality assurance managers make sure a company's products and services meet and maintain set standards.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
An understanding of British quality standards and working methods will be useful when applying for jobs in quality control.

Knowledge of business improvement methods like lean management and Six Sigma will also be helpful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in quality management through the Chartered Quality Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into senior management or work as a freelance quality consultant.

Other options include careers in health and safety, project management and business analysis.

Description.Html: Quality control assistants check that control systems and products meet recognised standards.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Some knowledge of British quality standards and working methods will be useful when applying for jobs in quality control.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in quality control through the Chartered Quality Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience and training you could move into supervisory, management or research jobs.

Description.Html: Quantity surveyors oversee construction projects, managing risks and controlling costs.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a quantity surveyor from the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors and Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior quantity surveyor or move into senior project management, supply chain management, consultancy work or self-employment.

You could specialise in areas like planning, risk assessment or contract disputes.

Another option is to move into lecturing at a university or college.

Description.Html: Quarry engineers explore new sites, oversee extraction operations and manage sites at the end of their commercial life.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join The Institute of Quarrying to help with your professional development.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in quarrying from Careers in Quarrying and The Institute of Materials, Minerals and Mining.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move into related careers like civil, construction and environmental engineering.

Description.Html: Quarry workers dig out and process rock, slate, gravel and sand from quarries or mines.

HtbCareerTips.Html: A relevant driving licence, for example a large goods vehicle or plant operator's licence, may give you an advantage when looking for work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working in the quarrying industry from Careers in Quarrying.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With training and experience, you could become a site supervisor, mineral products technician or quarry manager. You could also move into:

  • quality control
  • explosives work - shotfiring
  • health and safety inspection
  • machine and plant maintenance
  • laboratory work like testing samples

Description.Html: Racehorse trainers run racing stables, manage staff, look after horses' training and welfare, and prepare them for races.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about about working in horse racing from careersinracing.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could become a specialist racing consultant, trainer instructor, bloodstock agent or thoroughbred breeder.

Description.Html: Radio broadcast assistants help make sure that live and recorded radio programmes run smoothly.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
It's a good idea to develop a portfolio of your work on CD, MP3 or social media, so you can showcase your skills to potential employers.

For news-based and factual radio, you may have an advantage with a background in journalism or media research.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about about careers in radio from The Pips and BBC Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a radio producer, music programmer or a technical studio manager.

You could move into television research or production.

Description.Html: Radiographers use equipment to diagnose or treat patients who are ill or injured.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about a career in radiography from Health Careers and the The Society of Radiographers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a sonography specialist, radiography team leader or consultant practitioner.

You could also take further qualifications to specialise in:

  • counselling and palliative care
  • the use of certain techniques or equipment
  • working with specific groups of patients
  • research and teaching

Description.Html: Radiography assistants help radiographers with their day-to-day duties.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join The Society of Radiographers for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working as a radiography assistant from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could join the Society of Radiographers to help progress your career.

With experience and further study, you could go on to be an assistant practitioner or fully qualified radiographer.

You may be able to do this on a secondment basis with financial support from your employer.

Description.Html: Royal Air Force (RAF) airmen and airwomen use specialist skills for support roles in defence and peacekeeping missions.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find out more about working in the RAF through RAF Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
As an airman or airwoman you could move up the ranks to a more senior position like corporal or sergeant. You could also apply to become a commissioned officer.

You could go into a wide range of careers once you leave the RAF, depending on your skills, training and qualifications.

The Career Transition Partnership, Quest and Troops to Teachers have more information on careers outside the armed forces.

Description.Html: Royal Air Force (RAF) non-commissioned aircrew fly patrols over UK airspace and take part in NATO operations.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about working in the RAF through RAF Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and further training, you could progress to flight sergeant, then to master aircrew. You could also apply to become a commissioned RAF officer.

You could go into a wide range of careers once you leave the RAF, depending on your skills, training and qualifications.

The Career Transition Partnership, Quest and Troops to Teachers have more information on careers outside the armed forces.

Description.Html: Royal Air Force (RAF) officers manage teams of airmen and airwomen. They also carry out flying duties or work in specialist ground support.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about how to become an officer through RAF Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move up the ranks, for example from pilot officer to flying officer, then flight lieutenant or higher.

You could go into a wide range of careers once you leave the RAF. Your career choices will depend on your skills, training and qualifications you've developed during your service.

The Career Transition Partnership, Quest and Troops to Teachers have more information on careers outside the armed forces.

Description.Html: Rail engineering technicians install and service mechanical and electrical systems on trains.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a rail engineering technician from Network Rail and Transport for London.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You'll take work-based qualifications in personal track safety, installation, testing and maintenance.

You may work for train operating companies, London Underground, light rail and metro companies, rail freight and leasing firms. Specialist rail engineering maintenance companies are also big employers.

With experience, you could become maintenance team leader or engineering workshop manager.

Description.Html: Rail track maintenance workers inspect and repair railway tracks, bridges, tunnels and viaducts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a rail track maintenance worker from Network Rail and Transport for London.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could be promoted to supervisor or team leader. With further training, you could become a track inspector, engineering technician, track designer or manager.

Description.Html: Railway signallers operate the signals and points on rail tracks to keep trains running safely and on time.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Institution of Railway Signal Engineers for professional development.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a railway signaller from the Institution of Railway Signal Engineers and Network Rail.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a signalling supervisor or control room manager. With further training, you may be able to work as a signalling designer.

You may also be able to apply for non-signalling jobs through Network Rail’s internal promotion system.

Description.Html: Receptionists are the first point of contact for visitors to organisations.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a receptionist in hospitality from the Hospitality Guild.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With training and experience, you could move into a senior receptionist or personal assistant (PA) role.

In a GP surgery or health centre, you could train to become a medical secretary or a practice manager.

Description.Html: Recruitment consultants help employers find suitable staff, and match people to permanent and temporary jobs.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Institute of Recruitment Professionals, for professional development, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Whatever your qualifications, you'll be expected to have great sales skills and be able to communicate with people at many different levels.

You'll also need to have excellent customer service and teamworking skills.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a recruitment consultant from the Institute of Recruitment Professionals and the Chartered Institute of Personnel Development

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could move into business development or management, or set up your own agency.

Description.Html: Recycled metals workers grade, sort, clean and bale scrap metal for recycling.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about training to work in recycling from the British Metals Recycling Association and Talent Source Network.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a shift supervisor or manager after getting experience.

You could also become self-employed and start your own recycling business.

Description.Html: Recycling officers promote recycling in the community, and run local recycling schemes.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in recycling from the Waste Management Industry Training and Advisory Board.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into freelance work as an environmental consultant.

With further study you could become a chartered waste manager.

You may also be able to apply for chartered environmentalist status. You can find out more about being a chartered environmentalist from the Society for the Environment.

Description.Html: Recycling operatives collect recyclables like glass, paper and plastics from homes and businesses for sorting at waste collection sites.

HtbCareerTips.Html: An employer may give you training on the job, for example to get your large goods vehicle licence.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a recycling operative from Talent Source Network and the Waste Management Industry Training and Advisory Board.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With qualifications and experience you could move into a supervisory role at a waste collection site.

Description.Html: Reflexologists apply pressure to certain parts of the hands and feet (reflexes) which they believe can help with relaxation and wellbeing.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Association of Reflexologists and The British Reflexology Association, for training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may find it useful if you have experience in healthcare, massage, beauty therapy or counselling.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a reflexologist from the Association of Reflexologists and The British Reflexology Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could go on to train and qualify in other areas of complementary therapy, like aromatherapy, massage therapy or Reiki healing. This can help you to attract more clients.

With experience and further training, you could become a reflexology teacher. You could also coach or mentor newly qualified reflexologists.

ContentItemIds: «c#: await Content.GetContentItemIdByDisplayText("Occupation", "heating, ventilation, air conditioning (and refrigeration) service engineer")»

Description.Html: Refrigeration and air-conditioning installers work on air quality and cooling systems in buildings and transport.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a refrigeration and air-conditioning installer from the Institute of Refrigeration and the Air Conditioning and Refrigeration Industry Board.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a refrigeration engineer, designing cooling systems, or move into building services or plumbing. You could also set up your own business.

TitlePart.Title: Registrar of births, deaths, marriages and civil partnerships

Description.Html: Registrars collect and record details of all births, deaths, marriages and civil partnerships.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Each local authority sets its own entry requirements, so check with them for details of what you'll need.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could be promoted from assistant registrar to deputy registrar, then to registrar and superintendent.

Each district has at least one superintendent registrar and deputy, and each sub-district has a registrar and deputy.

data.DisplayText: Registrar of births, deaths, marriages and civil partnerships
data.Author: admin

Description.Html: Reiki practitioners use their hands to help people relax and improve their wellbeing.

HtbBodies.Html: You may wish to join the Complementary and Natural Healthcare Council, which has a voluntary register of reiki healers.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may find it helpful to have experience or qualifications in anatomy and physiology. Experience of working in a caring profession can also be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about reiki from the UK Reiki Federation, The Reiki Council and The Reiki Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With qualifications and experience, you could go on to offer training in reiki healing.

You could also offer other forms of complementary therapies like massage, aromatherapy, or reflexology.

Description.Html: Religious or faith leaders offer spiritual and moral guidance, and lead public worship and other religious ceremonies.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Becoming a religious leader is a serious commitment that can be seen as a calling as much as a career.

As well as a strong belief in your faith and its traditions, you should accept that the work will affect all aspects of your life.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Every religion or faith is structured differently, and career progression will vary from faith to faith.

You may be recommended for higher positions by senior members of your faith, or you may have to apply for vacant posts.

You may also have opportunities to become involved in teaching, counselling, interfaith relations, writing, or humanitarian and charity work.

There are also opportunities to work as a chaplain in the armed forces. You can find out more from:Army; Royal Air Force; Royal Navy

Description.Html: Removals workers move household and office furniture and other items from one location to another.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience of delivery driving or warehouse work could help.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about this job, including specialist training opportunities, from the British Association of Removers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to specialist packer, supervisor, manager, or removals coordinator.

You could start your own company.

Description.Html: Reprographic assistants use photocopiers and printers to make documents, brochures, leaflets and pictures.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience using desktop publishing software like InDesign or QuarkXpress can help. It will also help you if you've had any other roles where you've used printers and other business machinery.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in reprographics from the British Printing Industries Federation.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to departmental supervisor or production controller.

In a print shop, you could become a shop manager.

Description.Html: Research and development (R&D) managers lead teams of scientists and engineers to create new products and improve existing ones.

HtbBodies.Html: You'll usually be a member of a professional body relevant to your particular line of work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get an overview of research and development across different industries from UK Research and Innovation.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience in industry, you could become a senior project manager or research director.

In higher education, you could become a senior research fellow or professor.

Description.Html: Research scientists plan and carry out experiments and investigations to broaden scientific knowledge.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
It may improve your chances of finding work if you've got work experience in a research department or your degree included a placement in a research environment.

As a graduate you could look for postgraduate training opportunities offered through Knowledge Transfer Partnerships (KTP). In a KTP you would get the opportunity to run a research project together with an industrial organisation and a university or research body.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about a career in scientific research through the Science Council.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
As a scientist with research councils and institutes or in industry, you could progress to a senior research or laboratory management position.

In an academic post, once you've gained experience and published original research, you could progress to senior research fellow or professor, leading your own team.

You could demonstrate your commitment to professional development and work towards professional recognition like Chartered Scientist status.

Description.Html: Residential support workers look after the physical and mental wellbeing of children or vulnerable adults in care.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a residential support worker from Think Care Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could take on more responsibility as a senior support worker or manager.

You could also train as a social worker.

Description.Html: Resort representatives look after holidaymakers during their stay.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You may need specialist knowledge or skills for some holiday jobs, for example, as a winter sports representative you may need to be able to ski at an advanced level.

It can also help if you have a good working knowledge of one or more foreign languages.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details on working in the travel industry from Careers That Move.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could progress to senior resort representative or regional manager.

You could go on to work in tourist information centres, or for tourist boards or travel agencies.

You could also become a self-employed tour guide.

Description.Html: Restaurant managers oversee their venues and make sure customers are satisfied with the food and service.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: Find out more about careers and training from the Hospitality Guild.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a regional manager or hotel manager.

You could also set up your own restaurant.

Description.Html: Retail buyers choose products for shops to sell, like clothing, toys, electrical goods and food.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience and training you could become a senior buyer, buying controller or head of buying. You could also move into product management, marketing or merchandising.

Description.Html: Retail jewellers promote and sell jewellery, watches and accessories to customers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to specialist repairs, store management or buying.

You could open your own business.

Description.Html: Retail managers look after stores, motivate staff to achieve sales targets, organise promotional events and monitor industry trends.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could progress into area or regional management.

You could also move into more specialist areas, like customer service, training and operations management.

Description.Html: Retail merchandisers make sure that goods are in the right stores, or online, at the right time and the right price.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a retail merchandiser from the Fashion Retail Academy.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could be promoted to senior merchandiser and responsible for sales and budgetary control of a multimillion-pound department and managing a team of people. It’s typical to have reached senior merchandiser level within 7 to 8 years.

You could also become a merchandise manager, head of merchandising, merchandising director, retail business analyst or self-employed retail consultant.

Description.Html: Riding centre managers plan and run the centre's activities, manage staff and develop the business.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a riding holiday centre manager from The British Horse Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could do the Senior Trail Yard Manager qualification offered by the British Horse Society.

With experience, you could open your own centre.

You could work overseas. You could also become a qualifications examiner.

Description.Html: Road transport managers make sure goods and passengers reach their destinations safely, on time and in the most cost-effective way.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the The Chartered Institute of Logistics and Transport and United Kingdom Warehousing Association for professional recognition and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a transport manager from:The Chartered Institute of Logistics and Transport; United Kingdom Warehousing Association; Transport Planning Society

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could specialise in other types of transport, like rail, sea or air.

You could also move into transport planning and consultancy.

Description.Html: Road workers build and repair roads and motorways.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about training as a road worker from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a road works team supervisor, known as a 'ganger'.

Description.Html: Robotics engineers design and build machines to do automated jobs in industries like manufacturing, aerospace and medicine.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll find it useful to join robotics engineering groups or take part in robotics design competitions to build up your skills and knowledge.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can discover more about careers in engineering and robotics from The Institution of Engineering and Technology and the UK-RAS Network.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a lead engineer, with overall responsibility for managing a project.

You could also specialise in a particular area of robotics, for example self-driving vehicles, space exploration, surgical instruments or deep ocean research.

Description.Html: Roofers re-slate and tile roofs, fit skylight windows and replace lead sheeting and cladding.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Institute of Roofing for training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can do specialist training courses if you're interested in heritage and conservation skills in roof slating and tiling.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about careers in roofing from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You can improve your career options with a qualification like the Level 3 (NVQ) Diploma in Roofing Occupations. You can do specialist skills training in areas like heritage conservation, thatching or installing solar panels.

With experience, you could become a roofing surveyor, estimating costs, dealing with contracts and working with architects. You could also become a site manager or move into technical sales. Other options include training, setting up your own business or working as a roofing consultant.

Description.Html: Roustabouts work on oil and gas rigs, maintaining equipment, unloading supplies and helping the drilling team.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working in the energy industry from MyOilandGasCareer.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Your employer will put you through safety training. With experience, you could become a crane operator, or a roughneck, who helps with drilling operations.

With further training, you could progress to be a derrickman, assistant driller or driller.

Description.Html: Royal Marines commandos take part in frontline combat, and are sent at short notice to deal with emergency situations.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about how to become a commando from the Royal Navy.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With training and experience you could move up through the ranks and get a commission to become an officer.

You could go into a wide range of careers after leaving the marines. The Career Transition Partnership, Quest and Troops to Teachers have more information on careers outside the armed forces.

Description.Html: Royal Marines officers lead teams of commandos in combat situations, at sea and on land.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about how to become an officer in the Royal Marines from the Royal Navy.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
After 3 years as a lieutenant, you could progress to captain and then on to higher ranks.

You could move into other careers once you leave the marines, depending on the skills, training and qualifications you've developed during your service.

The Career Transition Partnership, Quest and Troops to Teachers have more information on careers outside the armed forces.

Description.Html: Royal Navy officers manage ships and submarine operations and are responsible for all personnel in their command.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about how to become an officer from the Royal Navy.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could be promoted to sub-lieutenant, lieutenant and the higher ranks.

You can go into a wide range of careers after leaving the navy. The type of career open to you will depend on the skills, training and qualifications you've gained while serving.

The Career Transition Partnership, Quest and Troops to Teachers have more information on careers outside the armed forces.

Description.Html: RSPCA inspectors investigate complaints about animal cruelty, and rescue animals and provide medical treatment.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find advice about working as an inspector through the Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (RSPCA).

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to chief inspector then regional superintendent.

You could move into management or training roles at the RSPCA headquarters.

Description.Html: Rural surveyors value the assets of farms and estates, advise clients on legal and tax issues, and plan and develop land use.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors or the Central Association of Agricultural Valuers for professional development training, industry news and networking opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience of working on the land, for example in farming or conservation, could give you an advantage when looking for work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about careers in surveying from the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could specialise in a particular area of rural surveying, like valuations.

You could move into a senior management position, partnership in a private practice or self-employment as a consultant.

Description.Html: Sailing instructors teach people to sail yachts and boats.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need to requalify as a sailing instructor every 5 years, and must have a valid first aid certificate.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a sailing instructor from the Royal Yachting Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into a supervisory or management job within a sailing club.

You could also become an instructor for other types of sailing vessels, like yachts and powerboats.

Description.Html: Sales administrators process sales orders and payments, arrange deliveries and offer after-sales support.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in finance from The London Institute of Banking and Finance.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a sales admin team leader, personal assistant or office manager.

Description.Html: Sales assistants sell products and help customers.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
It will help if you:

  • are confident about selling
  • have a positive, helpful attitude
  • can get on well with a wide range of customers

Some stores, like mobile phone or DIY shops, may expect you to have good knowledge of their products before you apply.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a retail supervisor, manager or departmental manager.

You could specialise in customer services or buying merchandise. You could also set up and run your own independent shop or stall.

Description.Html: Sales managers organise, coach and lead teams of sales representatives to work towards agreed targets.

HtbCareerTips.Html: In some jobs you could travel around the world to meet customers, so it may be helpful to speak a second language.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a sales manager through the Institute of Sales Management.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience and a good track record, you could take on larger sales areas or be promoted to regional or national sales manager.

Description.Html: Sales representatives meet or ring customers to persuade them to buy products or services.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It will help if you have experience or a background in what you're selling.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in sales from the Institute of Sales Management.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a sales team leader or an area sales manager.

The Institute of Sales Management (ISM) could help you develop your career.

Description.Html: Sample machinists make samples of garments to show designers or customers how finished items will look.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more information on working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move on to higher-level technical roles, like garment technologist or quality control technician.

You could also move into clothing design.

Description.Html: Satellite engineers install and repair telecoms equipment and satellite systems.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become a satellite engineer from the Confederation of Aerial Industries and Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With further training and experience, you could plan and design telecommunications systems, or set up your own business installing satellite dishes and equipment.

Description.Html: Scaffolders put up and take down scaffolding on buildings that allows workers to work safely at height.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Previous experience as a construction site labourer may be helpful when looking for work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a scaffolder from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a scaffolding gang supervisor. You could also become a scaffolding designer or construction manager, or set up your own business.

Description.Html: Scenes of crime officers (SOCOs) find, record and recover evidence from crime scenes.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Experience of dealing with the public and working in sensitive situations will be helpful.

Qualifications or experience in photography can also be useful and may be essential for some jobs.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about working in forensics from The Chartered Society of Forensic Sciences.

Check with your local police service for details of vacancies and entry requirements.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior or principal officer, with responsibility for managing a crime scene investigation (CSI) team.

You could also complete further training to manage investigations at major incidents.

Description.Html: School business managers are responsible for both the day-to-day and strategic running of a school.

HtbBodies.Html: You can find more details about professional standards and support from the Institute of School Business Leadership and GOV.UK.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working as a school business manager from the Institute of School Business Leadership and Skills for Schools.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could develop your career by moving to a larger school or college with a bigger budget. You could also move into financial or educational management with a local authority.

Description.Html: School crossing patrols help children and adults cross the road safely on their way to and from school.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find details of vacancies in your area from your local council.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could teach and train children and new crossing patrols.

Description.Html: Lunchtime supervisors work in primary, secondary and special schools, looking after children during the lunch break.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience of working with children and a first aid qualification could give you an advantage when applying for jobs.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find details of schools in your area from your local council.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior supervisor.

You could also become a teaching assistant.

Description.Html: School matrons look after the health and wellbeing of pupils in boarding schools.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more about working as a school matron from the Boarding Schools' Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could start as a house parent or assistant matron, then move to matron and senior matron.

You could also become a housemaster or mistress or head of boarding.

Description.Html: School nurses work with schools and families to improve the health and wellbeing of children and young people.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You may have an advantage when looking for work or training if you've got experience in health promotion or working with children in the community.

Knowledge of child protection and an understanding of family planning issues and the health needs of school children would also be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about becoming a school nurse from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a team manager or a community matron.

You could also become a manager of a service or work in education or research.

Description.Html: School secretaries provide administrative support in schools.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to school business manager, or personal assistant (PA) to the headteacher.

Description.Html: Screenwriters write the stories for feature films, TV programmes and computer games.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
As a new writer, you could get yourself noticed by entering screenwriting competitions. These competitions are run by broadcasters and regional screen agencies to discover new talent.

You can also find advice about submitting your work to the BBC at BBC Writers Room.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can get more advice on writing careers in film and TV from ScreenSkills.

You can get more information on working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Your career will depend on how successful you are, and how popular your work is.

You could combine writing with other work like teaching, lecturing or editing.

Description.Html: Search and rescue workers are volunteers who help lost and injured people to safety from mountains, rivers, caves and coastal areas.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You'll be expected to commit a certain amount of your time each month to training and call-outs.

You'll also have to supply most of your own equipment, which must meet the rescue team's safety standards.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a search and rescue worker from Mountain Rescue and the British Cave Rescue Council.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could specialise in particular rescue methods, like swift water and cave rescue, or take on responsibility for rescue dog training or vehicle servicing.

With experience, you could become a rescue team leader, operations co-ordinator or training officer. All positions will be voluntary.

Description.Html: Secondary school teachers teach children from 11 to 16, or up to 19 in schools with sixth forms.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You can do a subject knowledge enhancement course to improve your understanding of the subject you want to teach.

You can also attend teacher training events before you apply to get advice about the profession, the different training routes and funding. You can attend events in person and online.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can discover more about how to become a teacher from Get Into Teaching.

You can also search for jobs through the Teaching Vacancies service.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You can take on extra responsibilities, such as supporting pupils with additional needs, departmental or careers leadership, or pastoral support. You may receive extra pay allowances to do this.

With experience, you could become a specialist leader of education, supporting teachers in other schools. You could also be a curriculum leader, head of year, deputy head or headteacher.

You can work for an exam board, a local education authority, in further education, or with a gallery or museum as an education officer. You can also work freelance as a private tutor.

Description.Html: Secretaries provide administrative support for all types of organisations.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a secretary from The Institute of Administrative Management.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a personal assistant or office manager.

You could also move into human resources work, or train as a legal or medical secretary.

Description.Html: Security managers are responsible for protecting an organisation's buildings and keeping staff and visitors safe.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the International Professional Security Association for training and development opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in security management from Skills for Security.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become an area security manager, with responsibility for offices, shops or other facilities across a region.

You might specialise as a consultant, advising businesses on certain types of security, for example close protection, anti-terror measures or conflict management.

You could also set up your own security recruitment agency, or work for companies that develop and sell security systems, like biometrics or surveillance equipment.

Description.Html: Security officers make sure that buildings, valuables and people are safe and secure.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience of working in the police or armed forces could help you get into this job.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working and training in security from Skills for Security.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a supervisor, then senior or chief security officer.

With further qualifications you could go into security management or training, or set up your own security company.

Description.Html: Security Service personnel protect the UK against threats to national security.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers and training in this field from the Security Service MI5.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience and a good performance record, you could move into management. You could also move to another station in the UK or apply for opportunities with SIS and GCHQ.

Description.Html: Security systems installers fit and service electronic systems that detect intruders or control access to buildings and sites.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about the security industry from the National Security Inspectorate and British Security Industry Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become an installation, sales or maintenance team supervisor.

You could also specialise in areas like designing new security systems or set up your own security systems company.

Description.Html: Seismologists study shock waves created by earthquakes and volcanic activity. They also work in oil, gas and minerals exploration.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can discover more about working in seismology from The Geological Society and the British Geological Survey.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a project co-ordinator or manager with a seismic research organisation, university or energy company.

In a university post, once you've got experience and published original research, you could become a senior research fellow or professor.

Description.Html: Senior care workers provide physical and emotional support to individuals and supervise teams of care assistants.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in care from Think Care Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and training you could specialise in particular areas like dementia care, stroke management or in supporting people with learning disabilities.

You could also progress to become an assistant practitioner, deputy service manager or care home manager.

Description.Html: Set designers design and create the settings for commercials, television, theatre and films.

HtbCareerTips.Html: A DVD or online portfolio showing sets you've designed for amateur theatre, school plays or films would be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could work on larger and more prestigious film, TV and theatre productions.

Description.Html: Sewing machinists stitch pieces of material together to make clothing, accessories and soft furnishings.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about using your sewing skills in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could work with a designer, or as a 'sample machinist', making up samples of products.

You could also become a supervisor or move into staff training, quality control or pattern cutting. You could set up your own business as a tailor or dressmaker.

Description.Html: Shelf fillers put stock out on supermarket shelves and in display cabinets. They also remove out of date items and help customers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a stockroom supervisor, or train to work as a checkout operator, visual merchandiser or shift manager.

Description.Html: Shoe repairers mend footwear, and items like belts and bags.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
If you’re working for a large company, once you have experience you could progress into a management position.

With experience and financial backing, you could set up your own retail business.

You could also work in a high quality shoe-making factory.

Description.Html: Shopfitters make and install fixtures and fittings in offices, restaurants, shops and bars.

HtbBodies.Html: You could become a member of the National Association of Shopfitters.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in shopfitting from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into a supervisory role, like chargehand or foreperson.

You could become a works manager, contract manager or shopfitting designer after further training, or set up your own shopfitting business.

Description.Html: Shopkeepers manage their own stores or run stores on behalf of a retail chain.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join an organisation like the British Independent Retailers Association, for professional development, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get advice about starting out in retail from the British Independent Retailers Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could buy a franchise, or, with experience and an established brand name, you could expand or improve your premises or buy another shop.

Description.Html: Signalling technicians maintain and repair rail telecommunications equipment and signalling systems.

HtbBodies.Html: You can apply to join the Institution of Railway Signal Engineers, which offers professional development training to its members.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in the rail industry from Network Rail and Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move from junior to senior technician jobs and take on team leading responsibilities.

With more qualifications and experience you could become a signalling designer or incident investigator.

Description.Html: Signmakers design, make and fit signs for commercial and non-commercial use.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the International Sign Association UK for professional recognition and to make industry contacts.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a supervisor or manager.

You could specialise in different areas within the industry, working as an estimator, process planner or quality technician.

You could become self-employed, either independently or as part of a franchise.

Description.Html: Signwriters produce signs by hand and with machines for display on shops, businesses and company vehicles.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It's important to keep a portfolio of your design work to show employers what you can do when you're looking for jobs.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into work for TV, film and theatre.

You could also combine this job with signmaking.

Description.Html: Skills for life teachers work with adults and sometimes 16 to 18-year-olds to improve their English and maths.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a skills for life teacher from:FE Advice; The Education & Training Foundation; Get into Teaching

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: There may be opportunities to move into more senior roles like head of department, or to train other teachers.

Description.Html: Smart meter installers fit gas and electricity meters in customers' homes and businesses.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in the energy industry through the Talent Source Network.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a team leader or estimator, or set up your own installation business.

With further training, you could become an energy efficiency consultant, or move into gas or electrical engineering with an energy company.

Description.Html: Social media managers communicate with organisations’ customers and clients through social media channels.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about social media marketing careers through The Chartered Institute of Marketing.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into managing social media for larger companies or progress to a senior or head social media manager job.

You could also become an online digital community manager, acting as a link between consumers and businesses supplying online products. For example, working with gamers and games developers in the online gaming community.

Description.Html: Social services managers plan and co-ordinate the health, welfare and social care support provided by local authorities and charities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about working in social services from Think Care Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could specialise in a particular area, like mental health or children’s services.

You could also become a head of service, chief executive, assistant director or director of social services.

Description.Html: Social work assistants give advice, guidance and support to help people with their physical, emotional and social needs.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience of caring within your own family or community can help you get into this job.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in adult social care from Think Care Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could work towards qualifying as a social worker. You could do this yourself, or with support and funding from your employer.

You could also move into related careers like family support work or counselling.

Description.Html: Social workers help to protect vulnerable children and adults from harm or abuse, and support people to live independently.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It's possible to do a degree in social work and learning disabilities nursing. You'll need to check that the course is recognised by the relevant professional bodies. Course providers can advise you on this.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about becoming a social worker from the British Association of Social Workers and Think Care Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
During your first year in work your employer may offer you professional development, for example the Assessed and Supported Year in Employment (AYSE). This includes extra support like:

  • regular supervision
  • a training and development plan
  • time to meet your training and development needs

Each local authority will have a career pathway, with some offering the chance to study for a postgraduate MA in Advanced Professional Practice.

With experience, you'll find opportunities to move into management, research or study for a PhD. You could also become a practice educator and train and mentor students from your partner university.

Description.Html: Software developers design, build and test computer programs for business, education and leisure services.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You could build up your skills and knowledge using free online learning resources for programming languages, project management and software development methods.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working and training in computing from The Chartered Institute for IT and Tech Future Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior developer, with team, project management, planning or research responsibilities. You could move into related areas like systems design, IT architecture and business systems analysis.

You could also set up your own business or work as a consultant in most areas of the economy, for example business services, finance, cyber security, telecommunications and healthcare.

Description.Html: Soldiers take part in peacekeeping missions, supporting humanitarian efforts or fighting in combat zones around the world.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more information about careers in the army through Army Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
When you join the army, you sign up for 4 years. You can leave at any time after this as long as you give 12 months' notice. If you want to stay you can extend your 4-year contract.

With training and experience you could move up through the ranks or into a specialist unit like the commandos. You could also gain a commission to become an officer which would give you a higher salary.

You could move into a wide range of careers after leaving the army. The Career Transition Partnership, Quest and Troops to Teachers have more information on careers outside the armed forces.

Description.Html: Solicitors advise clients about the law and act on their behalf in legal matters.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join The Law Society for professional development, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Competition for training contracts is tough so you need to show that you have consistently good grades as you progress through your education.

Getting work experience in different types of settings can help you to stand out and show your commitment. There are work experience schemes to encourage people from black and minority ethnic communities, women and people with disabilities into the legal profession.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a solicitor through The Law Society, Law Careers.Net and All About Law.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a partner in a private practice firm of solicitors. As a commercial solicitor, you could manage an in-house legal department.

Description.Html: Solutions architects lead teams that design and develop new computer systems for clients.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to have an industry certification like Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL).

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll typically need knowledge of service design principles, agile development, and IT industry standards and regulations.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working and training in computing from The Chartered Institute for IT and Tech Future Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could progress to senior or lead solutions architect then move on to an enterprise architect role.

You could also take up broader IT project management jobs, strategy planning or consultancy.

Description.Html: Special educational needs (SEN) teachers work with children and young people who have special educational needs or disabilities.

HtbBodies.Html: You could become a member of National Association for Special Educational Needs to help with professional development.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You can attend teacher training events before you apply to get advice about the profession, the different training routes and funding. You can attend events in person and online.

You can find out more about developing your skills for working with pupils with special educational needs from National Association for Special Educational Needs.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can discover more about how to become a teacher from Get Into Teaching.

You can also search for jobs through the Teaching Vacancies service.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could become a special needs co-ordinator, head of department, deputy head or headteacher in your school, through training and promotion.

Description.Html: Special educational needs (SEN) teaching assistants support teachers to help children with special educational needs and disabilities.

HtbBodies.Html: You could become a member of National Association for Special Educational Needs for professional development.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
It'll help if you have some relevant skills like communication methods including British Sign Language or Makaton. or have some understanding of the needs of pupils with disabilities or conditions like sensory impairments or autism.

The National Association for Special Educational Needs produces useful guides and runs training courses and events.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working in special needs education through Mencap, the Royal National Institute of Blind People and Skills for Schools.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Your school will give you access to specific training, like British Sign Language and Royal National Institute of Blind People (RNIB) courses.

They may also provide training on conditions like dyslexia or autism.

With experience, you may take a course to become a higher level teaching assistant (HLTA).

With further study you could become a fully qualified special educational needs or mainstream teacher.

Description.Html: Speech and language therapists help children and adults who have speaking and communication problems.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a speech and language therapist from:Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists; Health Careers

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could specialise in areas like:

  • helping children with special educational needs
  • helping eating, drinking and swallowing disorders (dysphagia)

With further training, you could move into teaching and research. You could also become self-employed.

Description.Html: Sport and exercise psychologists work with athletes, teams and coaches to improve their motivation and performance.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join The British Psychological Society for professional development opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about working in psychology from The British Psychological Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work as a full-time sport psychologist or you could combine consultancy work with teaching and research.

As an exercise psychologist, you could work for a local health authority, or on a GP exercise referral scheme. You could also assess exercise programmes in workplaces, prisons or psychiatric settings.

With experience and further study you could become a senior psychologist or head of a psychology department. You could also move into lecturing.

Description.Html: Sports coaches teach sports skills to individuals and teams of all abilities.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Coaching awards are often more important than academic qualifications. But for professional coaching, some employers will expect you to have a relevant academic qualification.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about coaching and opportunities from UK Coaching.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With qualifications and experience, you could become a coach development officer, helping other coaches develop their skills and qualifications.

Description.Html: Sports commentators describe what's happening at sporting events to listeners and viewers and offer their opinions.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Sports Journalists' Association for training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Competition for jobs is very strong and very few jobs are advertised. Building up a network of industry contacts can help you find out about vacancies.

You'll need to record examples of your commentating on CD, DVD or online so you can show your skills to potential employers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in sports commentating from The Pips and BBC Academy.
