WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a studio-based presenter, move into programme making and producing, management, or written sports reporting.

Description.Html: Sports development officers organise projects and training to encourage people to take part in sport and have a healthier lifestyle.

HtbCareerTips.Html: There's a lot of competition for jobs, so networking and making contacts will give you more chance of finding work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about careers in sport from The British Association of Sport and Exercise Sciences.

UK Coaching has more on how to get coaching qualifications in any sport.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could become a sports development manager or a regional manager.

Description.Html: Sports physiotherapists diagnose and treat sports injuries.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Chartered Society of Physiotherapy for professional development and networking opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience of working with a local amateur sports team or club will be helpful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in sports physiotherapy from the Chartered Society of Physiotherapy and Physios in Sport.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could teach physiotherapy to university students, or set up your own sports physiotherapy clinic.

Description.Html: Sports professionals are skilled and talented sportsmen and sportswomen, who are paid to compete in their chosen sport.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
In most sports, you'll find it useful to carry on with your training or education in case you:

  • need another income apart from your sport
  • need another income for when your performing career is over

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details on what it takes to become a professional sportsperson from Sport England.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
In the more physical and contact sports, your career would usually be short. Many professionals finish their sporting career by the age of 35.

After your career ends, you could stay involved in sport by moving into areas like coaching, refereeing, team management, sports journalism or sports centre work.

Description.Html: Sports scientists use knowledge of how the body works to help people improve their health or sporting ability.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the British Association of Sport and Exercise Sciences (BASES) and work towards accreditation. You could also apply for Chartered Scientist status.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience as fitness instructor, lifeguard, coach or through volunteering, for example with a sports club, may improve your career prospects.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice on careers in sports science from The British Association of Sport and Exercise Sciences.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could find work with universities, schools and colleges, large sporting organisations, public and private enterprises and local authorities. It's also possible to become self-employed or to work as a consultant.

You could also move into a related career area, like sports development or performance testing and research.

Description.Html: Stage managers make sure the sets, equipment and props are ready for the opening of a performance.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Stage Management Association for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about becoming a stage manager from the Stage Management Association.

You can get more information on working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could manage a theatre company, become a theatre producer, or move into TV production.

Description.Html: Stagehands help to get things ready on set for performances in the theatre, at concerts and in TV and film studios.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may have an advantage if you've got skills and experience in carpentry, electrical work, sound or lighting.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about working and training as a stagehand from the Association of British Theatre Technicians.

You can get more information on working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could lead a crew of stagehands and scene builders. You could also take further training to become a production carpenter, sound or lighting engineer, or move into stage management.

You could also work freelance for theatre venues, TV or film studios, touring theatre companies and large-scale concert tours.

Description.Html: A steel erector assembles the metal framework of new buildings, and structures like bridges and tunnels.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll have an advantage if you've got a powered access licence to work with mobile elevated platforms.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about working and training as a steel erector from Go Construct and the Engineering Construction Industry Training Board.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a site supervisor or engineering technician, or move into related areas like welding, site health and safety or training.

Description.Html: Steel fixers install and tie together the steel bars and mesh used to strengthen concrete on construction projects.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about working and training as a steel fixer from Go Construct and the Engineering Construction Industry Training Board.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to supervisory roles, train to become an engineering technician or set up your own business.

Description.Html: Steeplejacks carry out repairs on buildings and structures to make them safe.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become a steeplejack from Go Construct and the Steeplejack and Lightning Protection Training Group.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could be promoted to supervisor or manager.

You could become self-employed.

Description.Html: Sterile services technicians clean and decontaminate equipment used in hospital operating theatres, clinics and wards.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join organisations like The Institute of Decontamination Sciences for professional development, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in sterile services from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to assistant manager, service manager, head of department or general health service management.

Description.Html: Stock control assistants keep track of stock levels and make sure there are enough supplies to meet customer demand.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a stock supervisor or manager. In these jobs, you would lead a team, forecast stock levels and work closely with suppliers.

You could also work as a retail buyer, looking at consumer trends and selecting which products your company will sell.

Description.Html: Stockbrokers manage their clients' investments by trading stocks, shares and other financial products to get the best return.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Companies sometimes offer summer internships and choose graduate recruits when their degree finishes. They usually recruit graduates through university job fairs.

Skills in a second language can also help you to find a job.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers and training in stockbroking from the Chartered Institute for Securities & Investment and the Chartered Financial Analysts Society UK.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and a good track record you could progress to become a trader, relationship manager or fund manager.

You could also become a partner or set up your own business.

Description.Html: Stonemasons carve blocks of stone, and lay and fit stonework into place on construction projects.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can do specialist training courses if you're interested in heritage and conservation skills in stonemasonry.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You'll find more on careers in stonemasonry from Go Construct and the Stone Federation.

You can also get more details about stonemasonary craft skills from the Crafts Council.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to supervisory jobs like site supervisor or clerk of works.

You could also move into a related area, like estimating and construction management.

With further training, you could work as a stonemason or bricklaying instructor at a college or training centre.

You could also set up your own stonemasonry business.

Description.Html: Store detectives prevent shoplifting in retail outlets and shopping centres.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about security training and licensing through the Security Industry Authority.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could progress to a senior post, like supervisor or security manager.

You could also become self-employed and work on contracts for stores.

Description.Html: Street food traders run their own businesses, serving customers food and drinks from a stall or van.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience in catering or customer service will be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in catering from the Hospitality Guild and the Nationwide Caterers Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move to a busier pitch.

Extra training in cooking and cuisine could help you to improve or widen the range of products you offer.

Description.Html: Structural engineers help to design and build large structures and buildings, like hospitals, sports stadiums and bridges.

HtbBodies.Html: You can become a member of The Institution of Structural Engineers.

HtbCareerTips.Html: If you're aged between 11 and 18, you can do 'taster' days and short residential courses with the Engineering Development Trust to get an idea of what it's like to study and work in engineering.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in structural engineering from The Institution of Structural Engineers and Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into construction design, project management, research and lecturing.

You could specialise in work like conservation projects, building using more sustainable materials or forensics where you might investigate why a building or structure has failed.

You could also move into consultancy work, like providing services to building insurers, or work overseas on construction and engineering projects with disaster relief agencies like RedR UK.

Description.Html: Sound engineers work in studios and make recordings of music, speech and sound effects.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
This is a job where getting experience and making contacts is important to help you to find work.

You'll need a good knowledge of music and recording technology. You may also find it useful to understand physics and electronics.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in sound engineering from Joint Audio Media Education Support.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could specialise in a particular technical skill, become a music producer, studio manager, or start your own recording studio.

Description.Html: Stunt performers stand in for actors when the script calls for anything dangerous or specialised to be done on a film or TV set.

HtbBodies.Html:
You'll need to join the British Stunt Register to get access to the Stunt Grading Scheme.

The register is divided into 3 categories of membership:

  • probationary
  • intermediate
  • full

HtbCareerTips.Html:
There are no official training schemes or schools to train stunt performers, although some private ‘stunt schools’ offer short courses in skills like stage combat, working with fire and stunt driving.

These courses can be useful for building experience, but will not be accepted towards membership of the register.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about minimum daily and weekly rates for stunt performers from Equity, the trade union for professional performers and creative artists.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a stunt arranger or co-ordinator.

Description.Html: Sub-editors check written content before it's published in newspapers, magazines and on websites.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join organisations like the Society of Editors and Professional Publishers Association, for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll also need to be able to use desktop publishing software for many sub-editing jobs.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about becoming a sub-editor from:The Publishers Association; National Council for the Training of Journalists

You can find out more about media and publishing careers from:Discover Creative Careers

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you may be able to progress to production editor or chief sub-editor.

You could also use your journalism experience to move into PR or work as a press or communications officer.

Description.Html: Substance misuse outreach workers encourage people to get help from local support services, and advise them on minimising risks to health.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a substance misuse outreach worker from Alcohol Change UK and Addaction.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior recovery worker in charge of a team, volunteer co-ordinator or project team leader.

You could also specialise in working with a particular user group, like young people.

Description.Html: Supervisors manage teams of staff and organise their workload.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers and qualifications in supervisory management from the Chartered Management Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With training and experience, you could move into middle management and then senior management positions.

Description.Html: Supply chain managers organise the movement of goods and materials from suppliers and manufacturers to customers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about careers and training in the supply chain industry through The Chartered Institute of Logistics and Transport.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to senior planning jobs and consultancy work.

Description.Html: Surgeons carry out operations and medical procedures on patients.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a surgeon from the Royal College of Surgeons and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and entry on the General Medical Council (GMC) Specialist Register, you could apply for senior or consultant roles, go on to lead a team, or manage a department.

You could also move into teaching and training students, trainee doctors and other healthcare professionals.

Description.Html: Swimming teachers help people learn to swim, improve their swimming skills and how to exercise in water.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about teaching swimming from Swim England and the Swimming Teachers' Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could be a swim co-ordinator or lead swimming teacher, checking the quality of swimming teachers.

You could work as the head coach of a sports club, or senior coach with a regional or national team.

You could also move into sports development or youth work.

Description.Html: Systems analysts look at a company's IT infrastructure and work out where to make improvements.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it helpful to get certification of your skills and expertise once you're working.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working and training in computing from The Chartered Institute for IT and Tech Future Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could be promoted to senior analyst. You might also move into project management or strategic business planning.

You could become a specialist analyst in a particular field like finance or retail.

You could set up your own business and work on a contract or consultancy basis.

Description.Html: Tailors design and make one-off suits, jackets and coats for individual customers. They also alter and repair clothes.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can get more on a career in tailoring from The Bespoke Apprentice.

You can find out more about creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a senior tailor or supervisor, or you could set up your own business.

Description.Html: Tanker drivers transport bulk materials and liquids by road.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about lorry driving careers through The Chartered Institute of Logistics and Transport.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could specialise in transporting particular loads or set up your own haulier business.

You could also move into transport and freight planning, driver instructor training, or distribution or haulage management.

Description.Html: Tax advisers help clients plan their finances to make sure they're paying the right amount of tax.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Chartered Institute of Taxation or Association of Taxation Technicians for professional development and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a tax adviser from the Chartered Institute of Taxation and the Association of Taxation Technicians.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could open your own tax consultancy.

Description.Html: Tax inspectors make sure the correct amount of tax is paid and investigate cases of fraud.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in taxation from Civil Service Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move through HMRC's promotion structure to more senior or specialist posts.

You could go into the private sector as a tax adviser, or become a self-employed tax consultant.

Description.Html: Taxi drivers pick up passengers and charge a fee to take them to their destination by the quickest route.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about working as a taxi driver from Careers That Move and the National Private Hire Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
If you're employed by a larger taxi firm, you could become a supervisor or manager in the dispatch control room. You could also move into taxi licensing with a local authority.

As a self-employed driver, you could become a taxi operator and increase your earnings by running a private hire firm, employing other drivers.

Description.Html: Taxidermists preserve mammals, birds, reptiles and fish for display in museums or private collections.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Guild of Taxidermists for professional development and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may find it helpful to have experience or qualifications in biology, anatomy or art and design.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about becoming a taxidermist from the Guild of Taxidermists

You can find out more about creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could lead a team of taxidermists in a museum or offer workshops for taxidermy amateurs and professionals.

If you're self-employed, you could sell your own work or offer a repairs and restoration service. You could also hire out models to the props department of a film, TV or theatre production.

As your experience grows, you could become a master taxidermist and get specialist commissions.

Description.Html: Teaching assistants support teachers and help children with reading, writing and learning activities.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Many teaching assistants specialise in the kind of extra help they give, for example languages, behavioural, pastoral or special needs support.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find more on working as a teaching assistant from Skills for Schools.

You can also search for jobs through the Teaching Vacancies service.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a senior assistant, apply for a higher level teaching assistant role or train to become an early years teacher.

Description.Html: Technical architects help plan, design and build IT systems for clients.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience of project management methods like PRINCE2 will be helpful along with a working knowledge of project development and information management practices like Agile and ITIL.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more advice on careers in computing from The Chartered Institute for IT.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to senior architect, or specialise in a particular field, like finance or security.

You could also move into broader IT project management roles, strategy planning or consultancy.

Description.Html: Technical authors write documents and guides that explain how to use products and services.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a technical author from the Institute of Science and Technical Communicators and Association of British Science Writers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a technical author for a larger organisation, or move into technical editing.

Description.Html: Technical brewers are in charge of the whole process of beer production and packaging.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Institute of Brewing and Distilling or the British Beer and Pub Association for training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in the brewing industry from Brewlab and the British Beer and Pub Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could progress to senior brewer or technical director.

You could become self-employed and set up your own micro-brewery.

Description.Html: Technical surveyors carry out tasks to support chartered surveyors, architects and engineers.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors for professional development training, industry news and networking opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about surveying careers and training from the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a self-employed consultant, or go into partnership with a chartered surveyor.

You could move into a managerial role, or a related job like town planner or wayleave officer, where you'll negotiate land purchase and access arrangements for utility companies.

Description.Html: Technical textiles designers research, create and test textiles for use in healthcare, manufacturing and construction materials.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about careers and training in textile design from The Textile Institute.

You can find out more about creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could work in a research department for a university or company that specialises in technical textiles, for example carbon fibre or graphene.

Description.Html: Telecoms engineers work on satellite, digital TV and fibre optic systems, and install broadband, mobile and landline phone networks.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in engineering from Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With training and experience, you could move into supervisory roles, network design or electronic engineering.

You could set up your own installation and repair business.

Description.Html: Telephonists, or switchboard operators, answer and connect calls and take messages.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Temporary work can be a useful way to get started in this career and can lead to permanent jobs.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could apply for jobs in a related area. You could apply for work as an administrator, customer services specialist or customer services supervisor.

Description.Html: Test leads plan and co-ordinate the testing programmes when new computer systems and applications are being developed or upgraded.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll find it useful to understand Agile IT project development methods.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in computing from The Chartered Institute for IT and Tech Future Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You can work in all parts of industry and commerce or specialise in a particular area, for example financial services, telecommunications or cyber security.

With experience, you can move into IT project management or become a test manager, co-ordinating several testing programmes. You can also work as a freelance contractor in the IT and business services industry.

Description.Html: Textile designers create fabric designs and patterns for woven, knitted and printed materials for clothes and interior furnishings.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join The Textile Institute and The Textile Society for professional development training.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need to present a design portfolio when you're looking for work. You can also use your portfolio to make job applications to companies whose products match your style.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about careers and training in textile design through the Crafts Council.

You can explore creative careers through Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to a senior design position or work as a textiles production manager.

You could also move into part-time teaching, university research or set up your own business.

Description.Html: Textile dyeing technicians create dyes to colour fibres and fabrics.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in textiles technology from the Society of Dyers and Colourists and The Textile Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into research and development, quality control or production management. You might also work in technical sales, acting as a link between dye suppliers and textile manufacturers.

You could transfer to different areas of manufacturing that also use dye technology, like the food and drinks industry.

Description.Html: Textile machinery technicians maintain, service and repair machinery used in textiles manufacturing.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about engineering careers from Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a shift supervisor or move into production management.

You might also specialise in quality control or research and development.

Description.Html: Textile operatives spin natural and synthetic material into yarns and fabrics for use in clothing, furnishings and industrial products.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could you could move into a machine maintenance job or quality control. You might also get promotion to become a production supervisor then shift manager.

Description.Html: Textiles production managers look after all stages of textiles manufacturing.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers and training in textiles production from The Textile Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into senior supply chain jobs, business development or marketing.

You could also find work with companies that specialise in technical textiles, like carbon fibre and aerospace materials.

Description.Html: Thatchers use traditional craft skills, materials and tools to replace and repair thatched roofs.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join organisations like the National Society of Master Thatchers to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may need to relocate to an area where thatching skills are in demand.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about thatching from the National Society of Master Thatchers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could set up your own business and take on other thatchers.

Description.Html: Thermal insulation engineers install insulating materials around pipes, boilers and ductwork in factories and buildings.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in thermal insulation from the Building and Engineering Services Association and ECITB Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could take further training while you work to move into a technical, supervisory or managerial role, like foreperson, site safety officer or building services technician.

You could also find work in a related industry, like heating and ventilation engineering or air-conditioning and refrigeration.

Description.Html: Tilers tile walls and floors in kitchens, bathrooms, shops, hotels and restaurants.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about tiling careers and training from Go Construct and The Tile Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and extra training, you could become a site supervisor, clerk of works or contract manager.

You could also work as a trainer and assessor on tiling courses or set up your own business.

Description.Html: Toolmakers make the precision tools that are used in manufacturing to create products and parts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in engineering from Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could become a workshop supervisor, train to carry out machine maintenance or move into quality control.

Description.Html: Tour managers manage the travel arrangements of holidaymakers and business clients to make sure their trips run smoothly.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Institute of Travel & Tourism, which offers industry training courses, news and networking opportunities to members.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in travel and tourism through Careers That Move.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a tour operations manager or specialise in particular areas, like food and drink breaks, adventure holidays or business travel.

You could also set up your own tour business.

Description.Html: Tourist guides show visitors around places of interest like cities, historic buildings and art galleries.

HtbCareerTips.Html: An outgoing and friendly personality, plus being able to speak a second or third language, will give you an advantage when applying for jobs. Experience of dealing with the public and giving presentations will also help.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a guide from the Institute of Tourist Guiding.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could work for a tour operator as a regional tour supervisor or manager.

Description.Html: Tourist information centre assistants give information to visitors about transport, tourist attractions and local services and activities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in travel and tourism from the Hospitality Guild.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a TIC supervisor or manager.

You could also move into local authority tourism departments, regional or area tourist board jobs, or to other areas of the travel and tourism industry.

Description.Html: Town planners help shape the way towns and cities develop, and balance the demands on land with the needs of the community.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Royal Town Planning Institute to work towards chartered status, find training opportunities and make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about town planning as a career from the Royal Town Planning Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could apply for chartered town planner status, and then become a planner or senior planner. With at least 10 years' experience you could become a senior manager or planning consultant. You could work as a self-employed consultant.

You could also move into environmental management, urban regeneration, recreation management and property development.

Description.Html: Town planning assistants process applications, give advice about regulations and carry out design work and office administration.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You may have an advantage if you have experience in:

  • customer service
  • administration
  • computer-aided design (CAD)
  • construction
  • surveying

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in town planning from The Royal Town Planning Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to team leader or move up to technician level. With further study, you could become a fully qualified town planner.

You could also set up your own business and offer consultancy in areas like planning law and sustainable design.

Description.Html: Tractor drivers operate farm machinery used to plough fields, plant seeds, and spray and harvest crops.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in farming from Tasty Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You can take further training to operate a wider range of machinery, which will increase your job prospects.

With experience, you could become an agricultural contractor, machinery engineer or farm manager.

Description.Html: Trade mark attorneys advise clients about registering and protecting designs and trade marks.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about training to become a trade mark attorney from The Chartered Institute of Trade Mark Attorneys.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move into senior management, or partnership in a firm.

Description.Html: Trade union officials represent, train and advise union members, carry out research and develop policy.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working and training as a trade union official through the Trades Union Congress.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a regional secretary of your union or move into a post at national head office. You could also move into politics as a councillor or MP.

Description.Html: Trading standards officers (TSOs) protect consumers and businesses by promoting a safe and fair trading environment.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll find it useful to have experience of legal, retail or advice work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working and training in trading standards through the Chartered Trading Standards Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior TSO or manager.

You could also move into private consultancy work.

Description.Html: Train conductors issue tickets to rail passengers and make sure that their journeys are safe and comfortable.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience of working with the public in retail or customer service could give you an advantage. It will also help if you have good knowledge of UK geography and the rail network.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about jobs in passenger transport from Careers That Move.

You'll find train operating companies through the Rail Delivery Group.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Train operating companies often promote existing station staff to conductor jobs, so you may be able to transfer from a platform assistant or onboard catering host role.

With experience, you may be able to progress to senior conductor or train manager, or transfer to a driver training programme.

Description.Html: Train drivers operate trains on the rail network, carrying passengers and freight around the country.

HtbCareerTips.Html: A good way to find out about trainee driver vacancies is to sign up for job alerts with train operating companies.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about how to become a train driver from The Train Drivers Academy.

You'll find train operating companies through the Rail Delivery Group.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Once you're qualified, you could work on passenger, freight or engineering trains.

With experience, you could combine your job with instructing trainee drivers, who are learning new routes and cab controls. You could also become a driver trainer, teaching new starters in the classroom, working with driver simulators and accompanying trainees on journeys.

You could move into management, supervising drivers and making sure trains and crew are where they need to be on the rail network. Operations management is another possibility, planning future rail developments.

Description.Html: Train station workers deal with customers and carry out duties in stations and on platforms.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It will help if you have a good knowledge of UK geography and the rail network.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about becoming a train station worker from Careers That Move.

You'll find train operating companies through the Rail Delivery Group.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could be promoted to senior station assistant, station team supervisor, assistant station manager and eventually station manager.

You could also become a ticket inspector and progress to revenue protection officer.

Description.Html: Training managers arrange and run training programmes in organisations.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: A background in teaching, lecturing in further education or as a skills assessor could be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a training manager from the Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience and contacts, you could become a freelance trainer or consultant.

Description.Html: Training officers plan and run courses and workshops for staff within organisations.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a training officer from the Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior training officer or training manager.

You could also become a freelance trainer or consultant.

Description.Html: Tram drivers take passengers to and from destinations, following a set timetable.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in passenger transport from Careers That Move.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into a supervisory role, like depot manager or route manager.

With further training you could become a driving trainer, teaching new staff how to drive trams.

Description.Html: Translators convert the written word from the 'source language' into the 'target language', making sure that the meaning is the same.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Language translation skills in demand include:

  • French
  • German
  • English
  • Russian
  • Chinese
  • Arabic
  • Spanish

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about becoming a translator from the Institute of Translation and Interpreting.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: Many translators work freelance or through translation agencies. With experience you could start your own translation agency, or move into teaching.

Description.Html: Transport planners manage road, rail and air transport networks at local, regional and national level.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Transport Planning Society or The Chartered Institution of Highways and Transportation for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a transport planner from the Transport Planning Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a senior transport planner or traffic engineer. You might also move into town planning, policy development or environmental consultancy.

You may improve your career prospects by completing the Transport Planning Professional qualification, or by getting chartered status with a relevant professional body.

Description.Html: Travel agency managers are responsible for the day-to-day running of travel agencies, meeting sales targets and promoting travel products.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working in travel from Careers That Move.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a regional manager, with responsibility for several travel agency branches.

You could also work as a business travel manager with a multinational company.

You could set up your own travel business.

Description.Html: Travel agents book and plan business and leisure travel for customers.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It may help if you have customer service experience and can speak a second language.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in travel from the Institute of Travel & Tourism and Careers that Move.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With training and experience, there may be opportunities to progress into senior roles like:

  • branch or call centre manager
  • operations director
  • regional director
  • managing director

You could also move into other roles in the travel sector, like tour operating.

Description.Html: Tree surgeons carry out tree work including planting, felling, care and maintenance, and hazard assessments.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the The Arboricultrual Association for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working with trees through The Arboricultural Association and the Royal Forestry Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With qualifications and experience, you could progress to supervisor or manager. You could also start your own business.

You could move into recreational tree climbing, taking people into treetops as an outdoor activity.

ContentItemIds: «c#: await Content.GetContentItemIdByDisplayText("Occupation", "assistant video and motion picture director")»

Description.Html: Assistant directors support directors by organising and planning everything on TV or film sets.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
It's important to get practical experience of the production process. You'll also need a network of contacts in the industry to help you find work.

You may find it useful to train in health and safety, as this is likely to be part of your duties.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about careers in film and TV from ScreenSkills.

You can get more information on working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to be a director, production manager or producer.

Description.Html: Camera operators record images for film, television, commercials and online.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can get more advice about how to become a camera operator from ScreenSkills.

You can find out more about creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a camera supervisor, cinematographer or director of photography.

You could specialise in a particular field, like underwater filming, aerial photography or wildlife work.

Description.Html: TV and film directors lead the creative and technical production for cinema and television.

HtbCareerTips.Html: A network of industry contacts will be extremely useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You'll find more details about directing in film and TV through ScreenSkills.

Shooting People has information, resources and networks for independent film-makers.

You can find out more about creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you might develop your own projects and raise the money to put them into production.

Description.Html: TV and film producers look after the business side of productions.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join The Production Guild, for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need a lot of experience in both the creative and business sides of film or programme making. You'll also need an in-depth understanding of the production process, and a good network of contacts in the industry.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about becoming a TV or film producer from ScreenSkills and ProductionBase.

You can find out more about creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become an executive producer, or set up your own production company.

Description.Html: Production assistants support producers in making film or TV programmes.

HtbBodies.Html:
You could join the The Production Guild for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

You can find out more about entry level opportunities in television from the Royal Television Society

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need to develop experience in both the creative and business sides of film or programme making. You'll also need to develop an understanding of the production process, and a good network of contacts in the industry.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about becoming a TV or film production assistant from ScreenSkills and ProductionBase.

You can find out more about creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to production coordinator and production manager, or become a researcher or producer.

Description.Html: Production managers take care of the business, financial and recruitment side of film and television productions.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join The Production Guild for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may find it helpful to have accounting skills and qualifications because of the budget management work involved with this job.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about working in production management from ScreenSkills and ProductionBase.

You can find out more about creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work on freelance contracts for television broadcasters or independent production companies and negotiate better fees based on your experience and reputation.

You could open your own studio or move into working as an executive producer, where you'll be responsible for several productions at once.

Description.Html: Sound technicians are responsible for recording the voices and background noise on TV and film shoots.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can get more advice about careers and training in sound for TV and film from ScreenSkills and the BBC Academy.

You can find out more about creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could progress from working for a small, regional company or station to working for a large, national one. You could also move into studio management.

Description.Html: TV presenters introduce and host programmes, interview people and report on issues and events.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Some broadcasters hold competitions to find new presenters.

You'll usually need a showreel, with clips of yourself on camera, to give to broadcasters, producers or media recruitment agencies.

Competition is strong, so you'll need determination, persistence and the ability to promote yourself.

Jobs are not always advertised, so you need to make industry contacts to find out who is hiring.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You'll find more details about working in presenting through ScreenSkills and the Broadcast Journalism Training Council.

You can find out more about creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With an established TV career, you could branch out into radio work, acting or writing for newspapers and magazines.

With experience, you could also choose to move into other areas within the media industry like production.

Description.Html: Typists use a computer to produce letters, reports and other documents.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and training, you could become a secretary, personal assistant or office manager.

You could also become self-employed.

Description.Html: Upholsterers pad, cover and re-cover furniture with materials like leather, suede or cotton.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the [Association of Master Upholsterers and Soft Furnishers (AMUSF) | https://www.upholsterers.co.uk/industry/benefits-of-membership/].

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into a supervisory or management position.

You could specialise in re-upholstering antique furniture or work in interior design. You could also become self-employed.

Description.Html: UX designers use research to understand their users and create websites, applications and software to meet their needs.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You'll find it useful to have:knowledge of development tools like HTML and CSS; experience of using design software like Adobe Creative Suite; experience of creating wireframes and prototypes by hand and with software; an understanding of agile project development methods

It'll help if you have a portfolio to showcase examples of your work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a user experience (UX) designer fromUser Experience Professionals' Association; Tech Future Careers

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could move into a management job and supervise other designers.

You could also move into a development role if you've got experience of programming languages.

Description.Html: User researchers collect, analyse and test data to design websites, software and applications based on user needs.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
It will be useful if you have experience of working in agile project development.

It will also help if you have a portfolio to show examples of your work to employers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a user researcher from the User Experience Professionals' Association and Tech Future Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could move into a management role and supervise a team of user researchers. You could also work on larger, more complicated projects as a head of user experience or research.

You could also move into a business analyst or product design role.

Description.Html: Vehicle body repairers mend damaged vehicle parts and bodywork using metalworking and finishing techniques.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working in vehicle accident repair from Autocity.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a lead fitter or technician, or move into supervisory and body-shop management positions in larger firms. You could also work as a vehicle damage assessor for a repair workshop or an insurance firm.

You could also set up your own business and move into mobile repair.

Description.Html: Vending machine operators fill, maintain and collect money from machines that dispense products like drinks and snacks.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Automatic Vending Association, for professional development, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about the vending industry from the Automatic Vending Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a supervisor or area manager, or set up your own vending business.

Description.Html: Vets diagnose and treat sick or injured animals.

HtbBodies.Html:
You could join the British Veterinary Association and British Small Animals Veterinary Association for professional development and networking opportunities.

You could join the British Equine Veterinary Association if you work with horses.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a vet from the [Royal College of Veterinary Surgeons | https://animalowners.rcvs.org.uk/veterinary-careers/] and British Veterinary Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could focus on treating particular animals, or specialise in areas such as dermatology or cardiology, by taking RCVS-approved postgraduate courses.

Experience in veterinary surgery could also help you to get a job in environmental conservation.

You could also move into a career in research and teaching with a university or research body.

Description.Html: Veterinary nurses support vets by caring for sick and injured animals.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the British Veterinary Nursing Association for training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a veterinary nurse from the British Veterinary Nursing Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could take on more responsibility, like practice management, supervising and training new staff, or working in veterinary supplies.

You could also train to specialise in working for a zoological/wildlife park, charity, pharmaceutical company or breeding/boarding kennels.

With further study you could work towards becoming a lecturer or researcher.

Description.Html: Veterinary physiotherapists work with injured animals, or animals with movement problems, to help reduce pain and improve their health.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Association of Chartered Physiotherapists in Animal Therapy for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a veterinary physiotherapist from:The Association of Chartered Physiotherapists in Animal Therapy; National Association of Veterinary Physiotherapists; The Institute of Registered Veterinary and Animal Physiotherapists

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior physiotherapist, or a specialist physiotherapist for breathing conditions or problems affecting the nervous system.

You could also set up your own animal physiotherapy practice or move into research.

Description.Html: Victim care officers support people who've been affected by crime.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about this career from Victim Support.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior victim care officer, unit or area manager, with responsibilities for a number of centres, staff and volunteers.

You could also move into witness care, with a greater focus on the legal and judicial system and making sure witnesses attend court.

Description.Html: Video editors bring together images and sound for use in film, TV and online productions.

HtbCareerTips.Html: As you get experience, you could make a 'showreel' DVD or online profile of productions you've worked on to demonstrate your skills to employers when looking for work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in editing from ScreenSkills.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Once established, you might use an agent to find work and negotiate your fees.

You could set up your own company.

Description.Html: Visitor attraction general managers look after the operation and finances of an attraction, and the health and safety of staff and visitors.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a visitor attraction general manager from the Hospitality Guild.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to senior roles like divisional, regional or group director.
